definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Inevitably, jealousy and desperation turn to enmity.
sentences.chinese: 嫉妒和絕望不可避免的轉化爲敵意。

sentences.english: His word finally foment her hostility.
sentences.chinese: 他的言詞終於引發了她的敵意。

sentences.english: His words finally fomented her hostility .
sentences.chinese: 他的言詞終於引發了她的敵意。

sentences.english: Calm and certainty have been replaced by aggression.
sentences.chinese: 平靜和自信被敵意和侵犯取代了。

sentences.english: He did not feel any real enmity toward Colleen.
sentences.chinese: 他對科琳不抱絲毫敵意。

sentences.english: Bankers have described the supertax as confirmation of the UK's hostility to finance.
sentences.chinese: 銀行家形容，附加稅證實了英國對金融業的敵意。

sentences.english: With the increased contacts will come more understanding and less animosity.
sentences.chinese: 多加交流將可帶來體諒，減少敵意。

sentences.english: But what they add up to is a division which breeds hostility.
sentences.chinese: 但它們合起來就是一個產生敵意的隔離。

sentences.english: Yes, enmities going back to medieval times can be healed.
sentences.chinese: 是的，源自中世紀的敵意可以癒合。

sentences.english: 'Of course, it's mine, ' said Soapy viciously .
sentences.chinese: “當然，這是我的，”索丕敵意地說。

sentences.english: The desire for freedom at home has trumped enmity towards the west.
sentences.chinese: 對本土自由的渴望，勝過了對西方的敵意。

sentences.english: Foreign hostility to China’s export dominance is growing.
sentences.chinese: 外國對於中國佔優勢出口的敵意在增加。

sentences.english: The opprobrium and enmity he incurred were caused by his outspoken brashness .
sentences.chinese: 他招致的輕蔑和敵意是由於他出言過於粗率而造成的。

sentences.english: Their hostile looks showed that I was unwelcome.
sentences.chinese: 他們懷有敵意的表情，顯示出我不受歡迎。

sentences.english: But there was a larger animosity at work in her polemics.
sentences.chinese: 但是她的論戰中潛伏着更大的敵意。

sentences.english: Some townspeople made no effort to hide their hostility.
sentences.chinese: 而鎮上居民毫不掩飾他們的敵意。

definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
